metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11144 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In PHP before 5.6.31, 7.x before 7.0.21, and 7.1.x before 7.1.7, the openssl extension PEM sealing code did not check the return value of the OpenSSL sealing function, which could lead to a crash of the PHP interpreter, related to an interpretation conflict for a negative number in ext/openssl/openssl.c, and an OpenSSL documentation omission.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11144` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.0 - 7.0.22-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libphp7.0-embed - 7.0.22-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
php7.0 - 7.0.22-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
php7.0-bcmath - 7.0.22-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
php7.0-bz2 - 7.0.22-0ubuntu0.16.04.1

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Sebastian Li, Wei Lei, Xie Xiaofei, and Liu Yang

criterions.comment: php7.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.22-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
